hero.title: Transforming Mental Wellness Through Art
hero.subtitle: From pain research to real-world relief

problem.title: Chronic pain faces a two-fold problem. Unlike diabetes, where a glucose meter and insulin guide treatment, chronic pain has no biomarker — only patient questionnaires and medications that come with risky side effects. The closest thing that people have to a "pain meter" is their words. At Pain+, we think that leveraging LLMs to study linguistic patterns may unlock better understanding and treatment of chronic pain.
problem.description: We provide a unified platform that gives people living with chronic pain and their healthcare practitioners an evidence-based, drug-free approach to managing chronic pain.
problem.statLabel: People worldwide living with chronic pain

hero.title: How It Works
hero.subtitle: Transform your pain management journey in four steps

steps.title: Express Your Pain
steps.description: Describe how your pain feels using your own words. Whether it's sharp, throbbing, burning, or something entirely unique - our platform captures your experience.

steps.title: Visualize Your Experience
steps.description: Our AI transforms your description into visual art using the National Gallery of Art's collection. See your pain represented through powerful imagery that communicates what words cannot.

steps.title: Engage in Evidence-Based Mindfulness Practices
steps.description: Review past entries to reflect on your chronic pain experience and how it has changed over time

steps.title: Track Progress and Gain AI Insights
steps.description: Receive concise and valuable insights about your pain experience. Using our proprietary "pain lexicon", gain insights to your linguistic patterns and receive personalized guidance on lifestyle modifications or habits that are beneficial to pain reduction.

hero.title: About Us
hero.subtitle: From pain research to real-world relief – powered by the voices of those with lived experience

story.title: Our Story
story.content: Based on her own experience living with chronic migraines and pelvic pain, founder Hannah Derue (PhD Candidate in Neuroscience at McGill University) founded PAin+. PAin+ is a software program that translates decades of pain science into accessible digital tools that help people better understand, express, and manage their pain. Our company prioritizes the voices of members of the chronic pain community, positioning them as leaders in our future direction. PAin+ sits at the intersection of art, neuroscience, and machine learning, transforming how chronic pain information is communicated, interpreted, and treated — from the research bench to the bedside.

mission.title: Mission Statement
mission.content: At PAin+, we aim to redefine how the world treats and communicates about chronic pain. Our mission is to empower individuals and clinicians through evidence-based, emotionally intelligent tools that make the invisible experience of pain both visible and actionable.
